stories.title: $34,000,000 / Remixpoint
stories.detail: Days after admitting to a hack that caused the loss of $32 million in cryptocurrency, Bitpoint Japan, a cryptocurrency exchange operator run by Remixpoint, said on Sunday (July 14) it has discovered an additional $2.3 million was stolen.

stories.title: $5,000,000 / Bitrue
stories.detail: Singapore-based cryptocurrency exchange Bitrue has acknowledged the fact that it suffered a major attack in which 9.3 million XRP and 2.5 million ADA worth around $5 million at the time were stolen from the exchange’s hot wallets.

stories.title: $10,000,000 / GateHub
stories.detail: the United Kingdom and Slovenia-based crypto exchange GateHub reported the loss of nearly $10 million worth of XRP. 18,473 accounts affected.

stories.title: $60,000,000 / Zaif Exchange
stories.detail: Japanese cryptocurrency exchange Zaif announced that it lost $60 million worth of company and user funds during a security incident that took place last week.

stories.title: $31,500,000 / bithumb
stories.detail: Bithumb, the world's sixth-largest crypto exchange by trading volume, was hacked. According to a company announcement, the South Korean exchange had 35,000,000,000 KRW, or $31,500,000 USD worth of cryptocurrency stolen in the hack.

stories.title: $40,000,000 / Coinrail
stories.detail: Coinrail, a cryptocurrency exchange based in South Korea, said its platform has been hacked, with other sources suggesting it lost cryptocurrencies totaling as much as $40 million in the attack.

stories.title: $3,300,000 / coinsecure
stories.detail: The Indian cryptocurrency exchange has accused Dr. Amitabh Saxena, the firm's Chief Strategy Officer (CSO), of being involved in the loss of 438 Bitcoins (BTC), worth roughly $3.3 million at the time of writing.

stories.title: $195,000,000 / BitGrail
stories.detail: An obscure Italian cryptocurrency exchange called BitGrail claims that it was hacked late last week and lost roughly $195 million worth of customers’ cryptocurrency. But others — including the developers who created the stolen cryptocurrency — have suggested not all may be as it appears.

stories.title: $534,800,000 / Coincheck
stories.detail: Coincheck, an exchange service, adopted cold wallets for their Bitcoin transactions but forgot to give adequate attention to security for NEM, a promising Asian cryptocurrency. They kept all deposits associated with NEM in a single wallet, and that was a costly error. No one can categorically explain how the loss occurred, but the aftermath was a devastating experience for their customers.

stories.title: $60,000,000 / NiceHash
stories.detail: A wallet address circulated by NiceHash users suggest that as many as 4,736.42 BTC – an amount worth more than $62 million at current prices – has been stolen.
